title.narrative: ED IR3.5: VAN - EARLY LEARNING & DVLPMNT

description.narrative: ED IR3.5: By 2017 young children in targeted areas in the Vanuatu benefit from increased access to quality Early Child Development (ECD) programmes through regional and in-country interventions, including during emergencies, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ED Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: An increased percentage of children aged 3 to 5 benefit from quality early learning and development opportunities.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination

Parenting Programme to promote nurturing care and early stimulation

Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ED IR3.5: By 2017 young children in targeted areas in the Vanuatu benefit from increased access to quality ECD programmesthrough regional and in-country interventions, including during emergencies

description.narrative: To further enhance quality early childhood care and education centre facilities and services, the Ministry of Education and Training has officially endorsed Vanuatu quality standards for early childhood care and education that include a monitoring and evaluation framework with (self) assessment tools and compliance mechanisms. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/01/2018

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2018:The Ministry of Education and Training (MOET) officially endorsed the Vanuatu quality standards (VQS) for ECCE and the monitoring and evaluation (M&E) framework in October 2017. The standards and framework, with M&E tool and compliance mechanisms, will allow MOET to better regulate the quality of EC
